intro: Borreria kohautiana, commonly known as the Mexican feverfew, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or yellow flowers and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in scrubland or thicket habitats. Borreria kohautiana is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
